word:
Sands, Virginia, Monday, November 10, 1890 [SEE 
           BELOW WHERE ELLEN WHITE GIVES THIS DATE AS "MONDAY, 
           NOV. 11, 1890." MONDAY FELL ON NOVEMBER 10 IN THAT 
           YEAR. FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS HER DIARY DATES ARE 
           ALL ONE DAY OFF. ON NOVEMBER 10 SHE WROTE AN 8-PAGE 
           LETTER TO ALBERT HARRIS (LETTER 72, 1890), URGING HIM 
           TO COME BACK TO THE LORD.] 


     I slept this morning unusually long. It was five o'clock before I left my bed. After a season of prayer, I wrote important matters to which my mind was called in a dream. I know it was a message for this people. I read the same in the early morning meeting. . . .
